articles.headline: Why Lead in Toy Paint? It’s Cheaper
articles.snippet: Paint with higher levels of lead often sells for a third of the cost of paint with low levels, so Chinese factory owners sometimes cut corners and use the cheaper leaded paint.
articles.abstract: Paint with higher levels of lead often sells for a third of the cost of paint with low levels, so Chinese factory owners sometimes cut corners and use the cheaper leaded paint.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, Sept. 7 — When Mattel, the world’s largest toy maker, announced its third recall in six weeks this month, the company asked consumers to return toys because they contained dangerously high levels of lead paint.

articles.headline: Pakistan Edgy as Ex-Premier Is Exiled Again
articles.snippet: Pakistan faced the prospect of fresh clashes after a former prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, was deported as he tried to return from exile on Monday.
articles.abstract: Pakistan faced the prospect of fresh clashes after a former prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, was deported as he tried to return from exile on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Sept. 10 — Pakistan’s president, Gen. Pervez Musharraf, faced the prospect of fresh clashes with a newly independent Supreme Court after deporting a former prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, as he tried to return from exile on Monday.

articles.headline: Fed Officials See Threat in Housing Turmoil
articles.snippet: Two Federal Reserve officials said Monday that problems in housing and mortgage lending have begun to threaten the overall economy.
articles.abstract: Two Federal Reserve officials said Monday that problems in housing and mortgage lending have begun to threaten the overall economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 — Three senior Federal Reserve officials said on Monday that the turmoil in housing and mortgage lending had begun to threaten the overall economy, a condition policy makers have said is the crucial test for deciding whether to lower interest rates at their meeting next Tuesday.

articles.headline: In the Ashes of His Life as a Broker, Inspiration
articles.snippet: Jordan Belfort, a former boiler room kingpin who now calls himself a moral man, says he sees his new confessional memoir as an atonement of sorts.
articles.abstract: Jordan Belfort, a former boiler room kingpin who now calls himself a moral man, says he sees his new confessional memoir as an atonement of sorts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jordan Belfort, boiler room kingpin, felon and fledgling author, cackled with glee. “There is the scene of the crime,” he said, pointing out a car window at the off ramp leading north to the Bronx.

articles.headline: Democrats See Politics in a Governor’s Jailing
articles.snippet: The case could be the centerpiece of an effort to show that the Justice Department engaged in political prosecutions.
articles.abstract: The case could be the centerpiece of an effort to show that the Justice Department engaged in political prosecutions.
articles.lead_paragraph: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. — House leaders are beginning an investigation this week of the prosecution of Don Siegelman, the former Democratic governor of Alabama who was imprisoned in June on federal corruption charges. The case could become the centerpiece of a Democratic effort to show that the Justice Department engaged in political prosecutions.

articles.headline: Guilty Plea Seen Aiding Tax Shelter Prosecution
articles.snippet: The plea by David Amir Makov is expected to bolster the government’s investigation of Deutsche Bank over its work with questionable shelters.
articles.abstract: The plea by David Amir Makov is expected to bolster the government’s investigation of Deutsche Bank over its work with questionable shelters.
articles.lead_paragraph: The government’s criminal case against promoters of questionable tax shelters took a step forward yesterday when an investment adviser at the center of the inquiry pleaded guilty and provided new details on those involved.

articles.headline: An Opportunity for Wall St. in China’s Surveillance Boom
articles.snippet: The ties between China’s surveillance industry and American capital markets are starting to draw Washington’s attention.
articles.abstract: The ties between China’s surveillance industry and American capital markets are starting to draw Washington’s attention.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENZHEN, China, Sept. 7 — Li Runsen, the powerful technology director of China’s ministry of public security, is best known for leading Project Golden Shield, China’s intensive effort to strengthen police control over the Internet.

articles.headline: Redefining the Architecture of Memory
articles.snippet: If an idea being kicked around  in an I.B.M. lab is correct, electronic devices could potentially hold 10 to 100 times more data in the same amount of space.
articles.abstract: If an idea being kicked around  in an I.B.M. lab is correct, electronic devices could potentially hold 10 to 100 times more data in the same amount of space.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif.  The ability to cram more data into less space on a memory chip or a hard drive has been the crucial force propelling consumer electronics companies to make ever smaller devices.
